Key to the families of Dicotyledons

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Asteraceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Asteraceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Outer involucral bracts leaf-like, often extending beyond inner bracts and florets; cypsela body retrorsely barbed; ray florets yellow
Outer involucral bracts not leaf-like, not extending beyond inner bracts; cypsela body antrorsely barbed; ray florets white or yellow if present
Leaves simple, trifoliolate or once-pinnate; ray florets absent, or if present, distinct and white to pale yellow
Leaves bipinnate or further pinnatifid or pinnatisect; ray florets absent or rudimentary and yellow; doubtfully naturalised in Victoria, see note following genus description
